contexts.context: ...parts of the surface that reject ink and <mark>depressed</mark> parts that receive it.
...processes use a metal plate in which shallow <mark>depressions</mark> receive ink, which is then transmitted to...
...to paper, making a darker tone where the <mark>depression</mark> is deepest, and a lighter tone where...
...is deepest, and a lighter tone where the <mark>depression</mark> is slight.
...copper plate will emerge from the process with <mark>depressions</mark> that are deepest in those areas which...
...can be darkened, for instance, by deepening the <mark>depressions</mark> in the copper.
